str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
One hundred. Of uncertain affinity; a hundred.
Twenty. Of uncertain affinity; a score.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
